newsitem.title: USA: Freddie Mac sets $990 mln in REMICs.
newsitem.headline: Freddie Mac sets $990 mln in REMICs.

text.p: The Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac or FHLMC) said it issued $990 million or Real Estate Mortgage Investment Conduit (REMIC) securities.

REMIC series 1929, underwritten by Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, is backed by $300 million callable pass-through series C032 and $290 million of additional 7.5 percent Gold pass-through certificates, Freddie Mac said. The issue priced on January 13 and has a settlement date of February 28.

Callable pass-through series C032 is made up of two pools of 30-year single-family fixed-rate mortgages, the agency said. One pool comprises $200 million of 8.0 percent paper, while the other contains $100 million of 7.5 percent product, it said.

REMIC series 1930, underwritten by PaineWebber Group Inc, is backed by $200 million of 30-year single-family fixed-rate mortgages, Freddie Mac said. The issue has a coupon of 7.5 percent, a pricing date of January 13 and a settlement date of February 28, FHLMC said.

REMIC series 1931, underwritten by Lehman Bros Holdings Inc, is backed by $200 million of 30-year single-family fixed-rate mortgages, FHLMC said. The issue has a coupon of 7.5 percent, a pricing date of January 14 and a settlement date of February 28, Freddie Mac said.
